title.native: 美少女戦士セーラームーンCrystal

description:
Tsukino Usagi is a clumsy crybaby, but otherwise very cheerful 8th grade student. One day she meets a cat named Luna with a crescent moon on her head, and is transformed into the sailor-suited guardian of love and justice, Sailor Moon! As a chosen guardian of justice, Usagi has a mission … to find her comrades; to find the Phantom Silver Crystal; and protect the Princess. However, Queen Beryl of the Dark Kingdom also seeks the terrible power of the Silver Crystal, and sends her agents into the city where Usagi lives; triggering the start of a fierce battle.

Will Sailor Moon be able to find the other Sailor Guardians, and if she does, together can they find the Phantom Silver Crystal and protect the Princess?!
hashtag: #sailormoon #sailormooncrystal #セーラームーンCrystal #prettyguardian #セーラームーン

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

node.description: Naoko Takeuchi is a manga artist who lives in Tokyo, Japan. Takeuchi's works are widely admired by anime/manga fans. She is a well-known mangaka in the United States. Her most popular work, Sailor Moon, has been widely reprinted and marketed in North America. She also wrote the lyrics for a number of songs featured in the Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon anime and live-action series. They are mainly character-based image songs, but do include a few theme songs. She has won several awards including the 2nd Nakayoshi Comic Prize for Newcomers, for “Yume ja Nai no Ne,” in 1985. She also won for "Love Call" which won Nakayoshi's New Artist award which debuted in the Nakayoshi Deluxe September 1986 issue. In 1993 she won the 17th Kodansha Manga Award for shoujo for Sailor Moon. She is also married to the author of Hunter x Hunter and Yu Yu Hakusho, [Togashi Yoshihiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96893).

[Official Website](https://www.momoclo.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/momoclo_king_pr) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6YNWTm6zuMFsjqd0PO3G-Q)

Momoiro Clover Z (abbreviated Momoclo) is a four member idol girl group represented by Stardust Promotion under Section 3's 3Bjunior. The group was formed in 2008, originally under the name Momoiro Clover. The group gradually garnered popularity and fanbase following their single debut in 2009 and major debut in 2010.

They are known for their energetic and acrobatic performances, color-coded system and unconventional concepts. 

Their sister group is [Shiritsu Ebisu Chuugaku](https://anilist.co/staff/149421/Shiritsu-Ebisu-Chuugaku).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/munehisa_sakai)

Previoulsy affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation) and [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA). Currently working at [Studio KAI](https://anilist.co/studio/6312/Studio-KAI).

Director who started off as an animator. Still animates on occasions.

Married to [Sayo Aoi](https://anilist.co/staff/118784/).

An animator, character designer and animation director.
A director and animation director. She is most known by her works under Toei Animation.
Mitsuka is an animator, storyboarder, episode director, and director currently working at Toei Animation.

**[SOUND BOX Profile (JP)](http://www.sound-box.jp/information/shizuo_k.html)** | **[SOUND BOX Profile (EN)](http://www.sound-box.jp/english/information/shizuo_k.html)**

Shizuo Kurahashi is a Japanese sound effects editor. He worked as an editor at the Nikkatsu filming studio. After that he started his sound career in ToyoOnkyo. 

He established his own company SOUND BOX in 1988. Since 1983, when the dolby stereo system got popular in Japan - he has been creating filmsounds. He has edited and arranged sounds for over 1000 works.
